P1.title: Social Mirroring Sensitivity
P1.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you respond to subtle changes in communication.
P1.insight: Your responses suggest a heightened awareness of relational dynamics. You tend to adjust your communication style based on perceived emotional shifts in others.
supporting_bullets: You notice when someone’s tone or energy changes mid-conversation
You interpret pauses or delayed replies as meaningful signals

P2.title: Protective Withdrawal
P2.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you respond when emotional uncertainty increases.
P2.insight: Your answers show a tendency to create space when something feels unclear. You protect your emotional equilibrium by stepping back until you understand the situation better.

P3.title: Optimistic Projection
P3.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you fill in emotional gaps during communication.
P3.insight: You tend to assume positive intent when signals are ambiguous. This allows you to stay open and hopeful, even when information is incomplete.

P4.title: Ambiguity Stress
P4.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you react when communication signals feel inconsistent.
P4.insight: You become more alert when messages don’t align. Conflicting cues make you pause and evaluate the emotional landscape before moving forward.

P5.title: Connection Momentum
P5.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you respond when a conversation feels emotionally aligned.
P5.insight: Your responses suggest that when energy feels good, you naturally increase engagement. You match enthusiasm and may even amplify it to maintain the connection.

P6.title: Cautious Interpretation
P6.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you process conversations when clarity is uncertain.
P6.insight: You slow things down to avoid misreading signals. You prefer to gather context before assuming meaning, which keeps your emotional responses grounded.

P7.title: Emotional Anchoring
P7.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you use past signals to understand new ones.
P7.insight: You rely on previous interactions to interpret what’s happening now. Consistency and track records matter to you and guide how you respond emotionally.

P8.title: Narrative Completion
P8.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you make sense of missing information.
P8.insight: You tend to connect dots quickly. When something isn’t explicitly stated, you naturally construct a story to understand the emotional context.

P9.title: Empathic Overreach
P9.subtitle: This pattern reflects how deeply you take on other people’s emotional cues.
P9.insight: You absorb emotional signals intensely, sometimes reading more into a message than the sender intended. This often comes from strong empathy rather than insecurity.

P10.title: Independent Processing
P10.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you handle emotional information privately.
P10.insight: You prefer space to think things through. You often make sense of emotional cues internally before responding, which helps you feel grounded and in control.

P11.title: Reciprocity Mapping
P11.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you match emotional depth and vulnerability.
P11.insight: You respond proportionally to what others share. When someone opens up, you’re more likely to open up too — but you rarely go first without an emotional signal from them.

P12.title: Meaning Sensitivity
P12.subtitle: This pattern reflects how you interpret subtle shifts in communication.
P12.insight: You assign meaning quickly based on small emotional cues. Even brief changes in timing, tone, or pacing can feel significant and shape how you respond.
